docs.snippet: Uruguay and Brazil have played each other 25 times in the Copa América -- and even there, the teams are dead even. Each side one nine times, with seven games ending in draws.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than any other match between two rivals, every Brazil-Uruguay game is defined by one single meeting that took place back in the mists of time. It was a match so enormous, it affected the entire history of soccer, and even though it took place 57 years ago and many of those who took part in it are long gone, it will nevertheless certainly be mentioned over and over during and after tonight's Copa América semifinal.
docs.abstract: Uruguay and Brazil have played each other 25 times in the Copa América -- and even there, the teams are dead even. Each side one nine times, with seven games ending in draws.

headline.main: Uruguay-Brazil: In the Shadows of History

docs.snippet: Chants by Venezuelan fans of "Freedom" and "This government is going to fall" --particularly at games in Maracaibo, the country's second-largest city, a redoubt of opposition to the government of President Hugo Chávez, and scene of tonight's...
docs.abstract: Chants by Venezuelan fans of "Freedom" and "This government is going to fall" --particularly at games in Maracaibo, the country's second-largest city, a redoubt of opposition to the government of President Hugo Chávez, and scene of tonight's Brazil-Uruguay semifinal -- have accompanied the euphoria over the occasional goal.

docs.snippet: You might think that Brazil should ace this one, but Uruguay has an enviable record against them.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Copa America rolls into the semifinal stages, hot on the heels of a set of quarterfinals that produced 22 goals. Will such free-scoring antics continue? Find out LIVE tonight at 8:45 pm eastern when Brazil takes on Uruguay in Maracaibo, Venezuela. Duncan Irving will bring you minute-by-minute match commentary.
docs.abstract: You might think that Brazil should ace this one, but Uruguay has an enviable record against them.

docs.snippet: Duncan Irving's LIVE updates of tonight's Copa America semifinal between Brazil and Uruguay from Maracaibo.
docs.lead_paragraph: For Duncan Irving's updates of tonight's Copa America semifinal between Brazil and Uruguay from Maracaibo, click "read more."
docs.abstract: Duncan Irving's LIVE updates of tonight's Copa America semifinal between Brazil and Uruguay from Maracaibo.

headline.main: FINAL: Brazil 2, Uruguay 2 (Brazil win 5-4 on penalties)

docs.snippet: Goalkeeper Chris Seitz has remained out of the spotlight during the under-20 World Cup, and that’s been a good thing for the United States, which has played attractive, attacking soccer, for the most part.

docs.snippet: Brazil advanced to the Copa América final yesterday, eliminating Uruguay, 5-4, on penalty kicks in Maracaibo, Venezuela.Brazil advances to meet the winner of today’s semifinal between Mexico and Argentina.The score was tied at 2-2 after...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil advanced to the Copa América final yesterday, eliminating Uruguay, 5-4, on penalty kicks in Maracaibo, Venezuela.Brazil advances to meet the winner of today’s semifinal between Mexico and Argentina.The score was tied at 2-2 after regulation. Gilberto converted to put Brazil in front, 5-4, in penalty kicks, and goalie Doni clinched the victory by stopping Diego Lugano’s shot.

docs.snippet: Brazil advanced to the Copa América final yesterday, eliminating Uruguay, 5-4, on penalty kicks in Maracaibo, Venezuela.Brazil advances to meet the winner of today's semifinal between Mexico and Argentina.The score was tied at 2-2 after regulation....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil advanced to the Copa América final yesterday, eliminating Uruguay, 5-4, on penalty kicks in Maracaibo, Venezuela.Brazil advances to meet the winner of today's semifinal between Mexico and Argentina.The score was tied at 2-2 after regulation. Gilberto converted to put Brazil in front, 5-4, in penalty kicks, and goalie Doni clinched the victory by stopping Diego Lugano's shot.
docs.abstract: Brazil defeats Uruguay, 5-4, to advance to Copa America final (S)

docs.snippet: Last night, Brazil beat Uruguay on penalties in the semifinal of the Copa America thanks to Brazil keeper Doni's blatantly illegal save on the decisive kick.
docs.lead_paragraph: Penalty shootouts are a notoriously unfair way to determine a winner in big tournament games, but a winner must be chosen, and spot kicks are the only way to do it. Still, given that, couldn't they at least be conducted according to the rules?
docs.abstract: Last night, Brazil beat Uruguay on penalties in the semifinal of the Copa America thanks to Brazil keeper Doni's blatantly illegal save on the decisive kick.

headline.main: Advice to Goalkeepers: Cheat on Penalties
